Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text, including demotic docket. 8 lines on recto, names of 17 witnesses on verso. Dated year 20 of Ptolemy Epiphanes, day 18 of Phamenoth. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale of tombs by Amenhotep son of Harsiese to his sister Tsenamun. scribe Paby son of Klwz".
Bibliographic references: Reich 1914 / Papyri juistischen Inhalts in hieratischer und demotischer Schrift aus dem British Museum (p.73-7, pl.11-4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2723) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2723)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: frayed, fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: C Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: D Curatorial condition comment: fair
